tasks.title: Phase 1: Core Sui Infrastructure
tasks.description: Research and document core Sui infrastructure (Sui, BCS, Fastcrypto, Narwhal).
tasks.details: Explore repositories, verify functionality with CLI/curl, and update sui-docs.

tasks.title: Phase 3: Tools and Specialized SDKs
tasks.description: Research and document specialized tools and SDKs (Deepbookpy, Sui Butler, Sui DeFi Vault, Core-ts).
tasks.details: Explore repositories, verify functionality with CLI/curl, and update sui-docs.

tasks.title: Phase 4: Community and Utility Projects
tasks.description: Research and document community projects (Memetic-LaunchPad, Cetus Volume Booster, GemWallet).
tasks.details: Explore repositories, verify functionality with CLI/curl, and update sui-docs.

tasks.title: Phase 2: Major DeFi Protocols
tasks.description: Research and document major DeFi protocols (Scallop, Navi, Cetus, SeaProtocol, Legato Finance).
tasks.details: Explore repositories, verify functionality with CLI/curl, and update sui-docs.

tasks.title: Phase 5: Practical Examples & ID Resolution
tasks.description: Add concrete code examples and resolve actual protocol Object IDs for verification scripts.
tasks.details: Populate /examples with TS/Move snippets and update /scripts with real addresses.

tasks.title: Phase 6: Live Protocol Verification
tasks.description: Execute and validate the verification scripts across core and DeFi protocols.
tasks.details: Run verify-sui-core.sh, verify-signatures.sh, and verify-defi-protocols.sh. Resolve any object ID gaps.

tasks.title: Implement Common Monitoring Utilities
tasks.description: Create shared utility functions for RPC connection and reporting to be used by both Scallop and Suilend monitoring scripts.
tasks.details:
1. Create `utils/monitoring_common.ts`.
2. Initialize `SuiClient` connecting to Mainnet.
3. Define a TypeScript interface `LiquidationCandidate` containing fields: `obligationId`, `owner`, `healthFactor`, `debtValue`, and `protocol`.
4. Implement a logging utility to output identified candidates in a readable format.
tasks.testStrategy: Create a simple test script that imports the client and successfully fetches the current epoch from the Sui network to verify connectivity.

tasks.title: Develop Scallop Obligation Monitoring Script
tasks.description: Implement the logic to query Scallop protocol obligations and identify accounts susceptible to liquidation.
tasks.details:
1. Create `scripts/monitor_scallop.ts`.
2. Import Scallop SDK and `utils/monitoring_common.ts`.
3. Use the SDK to query all obligations (paginate if necessary).
4. Iterate through obligations and filter for `healthFactor < 1`.
5. Output list of liquidatable obligations to console.
tasks.testStrategy: Run `npx ts-node scripts/monitor_scallop.ts` and verify it runs without crashing. Mock an obligation with HF < 1 if none exist on mainnet to verify filtering logic.

tasks.title: Develop Suilend Obligation Monitoring Script
tasks.description: Implement the logic to query Suilend protocol obligations and identify accounts susceptible to liquidation.
tasks.details:
1. Create `scripts/monitor_suilend.ts`.
2. Import Suilend SDK and `utils/monitoring_common.ts`.
3. Fetch Suilend reserves and obligations data.
4. Calculate Health Factor using protocol-specific formulas exposed by SDK.
5. Filter for `healthFactor < 1` and report.
tasks.testStrategy: Run `npx ts-node scripts/monitor_suilend.ts` and verify execution. Compare output against Suilend frontend data for accuracy.

tasks.title: Verify and Document Curl Commands
tasks.description: Test the provided list of 33 curl commands for Sui developers and document them.
tasks.details:
1. Create or update `manual/utility-tools.md`.
2. Systematically execute each of the 33 curl commands against a public RPC node.
3. Verify the JSON-RPC response is valid.
4. Document the command syntax and expected output in the markdown file.
tasks.testStrategy: Manual verification: Execute each command in terminal and ensure no errors are returned before adding to documentation.

tasks.title: Update Token Registry Documentation
tasks.description: Research recent asset launches on Sui and update the manual entry for the token registry.
tasks.details:
1. Analyze recent mainnet token launches (e.g., meme coins, new defi tokens).
2. Update `manual/14-token-registry.md`.
3. Add CoinType, Symbol, Decimals, and Icon URL for new verified assets.
tasks.testStrategy: Review the rendered Markdown to ensure tables are formatted correctly and links are valid.

tasks.title: Cyclic Arbitrage: Pool Setup & Strategy Design
tasks.description: Initialize the arbitrage script and define the pools for the SUI -> USDC -> CETUS -> SUI route.
tasks.details:
1. Create `examples/defi/cyclic_arbitrage.ts`.
2. Define Pool Object IDs for:
   - SUI/USDC (DeepBook or Cetus)
   - USDC/CETUS (Cetus)
   - CETUS/SUI (Cetus)
3. Initialize Cetus SDK and DeepBook SDK instances within the script.
tasks.testStrategy: Log the pool details (liquidity, current tick) to console to ensure correct Pool IDs and SDK initialization.

tasks.title: Cyclic Arbitrage: PTB Implementation
tasks.description: Construct the Programmable Transaction Block (PTB) to execute the three-hop swap.
tasks.details:
1. In `examples/defi/cyclic_arbitrage.ts`, start a new TransactionBlock.
2. Add inputs for the swap amount (e.g., 1 SUI).
3. Step 1: Add command for SUI -> USDC swap (using DeepBook SDK).
4. Step 2: Add command for USDC -> CETUS swap (using Cetus SDK).
5. Step 3: Add command for CETUS -> SUI swap (using Cetus SDK).
6. Ensure output of previous swap is passed as input to the next.
tasks.testStrategy: Use TypeScript type checking to ensure argument types match SDK requirements for the PTB construction.

tasks.title: Cyclic Arbitrage: Dry-run Verification
tasks.description: Execute the arbitrage PTB using devInspectTransactionBlock to verify logic without spending funds.
tasks.details:
1. Add execution logic to `examples/defi/cyclic_arbitrage.ts`.
2. Use `client.devInspectTransactionBlock` with the constructed PTB.
3. Parse the transaction effects to calculate net balance change.
4. Log 'Profit' or 'Loss' based on the simulation results.
tasks.testStrategy: Run `npx ts-node examples/defi/cyclic_arbitrage.ts`. Ensure the script completes and outputs the simulated balance changes.

tasks.title: Global Build Verification
tasks.description: Ensure all TypeScript code in the repository adheres to type safety standards.
tasks.details:
1. Run `npx tsc --noEmit` from the root directory.
2. Resolve any type errors arising from the new monitoring scripts or arbitrage examples.
3. Ensure compatibility with the pinned SDK versions in `package.json`.
tasks.testStrategy: The task is complete when `npx tsc` returns exit code 0 with no errors.

tasks.title: Update Roadmap and Readme
tasks.description: Finalize documentation by updating the README with completed milestones and usage instructions.
tasks.details:
1. Edit `README.md`.
2. Check off the items for Monitoring Layer and Cyclic Arbitrage.
3. Add a section 'Running the Examples' with commands like `npx ts-node scripts/monitor_scallop.ts`.
tasks.testStrategy: Preview `README.md` to ensure formatting is correct and instructions are clear.
